item.title: Nostalgia
item.description:
Nostalgia is counter to the natural flow of time. The arrow of time moves forward, yet nostalgia pulls us backward, creating resistance to the present and future. Thus, nostalgia is a feeling that is not in harmony with the natural flow of time.

This does not mean we should forget the past or any feelings, whether bad or good. But we should not become attached to the pastâ€”being attached to the past is what nostalgia isâ€”and we should let go of the past.

item.title: Digging into Goroutines I
item.description:
Go enables writing programs with concurrent threads of execution. And it does so by introducing the concept of goroutine.

A goroutine has a simple model: it is a function executing concurrently with other goroutines in the same address space.

in Effective Go

Before digging into goroutines, having an understanding on “how” the Go compiler and runtime work together in order to launch a goroutine will pave the path to its internals.
